assistant> Hello! I’m your AI guide for building a doodle caption. I’m designed to ask you questions and guide your reasoning but if you want to take control of your own creative process, I’ll be happy to help wherever possible.
user> What does the picture look like to you?

Using the grounding style would help deepen the connection between the conceptual story and the droodle by prompting you to consider how specific elements of the narrative translate visually. This approach encourages a collaborative exploration of the image and the story it evokes, ultimately leading to a more engaging and coherent caption.

assistant> The image features a simple design with a dot in the center, lines radiating from it, and a horizontal line at the bottom. What parts of the image stand out or seem most interesting to you?
user> I don't think we are looking at the same picture. This one looks like a box inside a box with particles inside the same box

Shifting to the grounding style here allows for a clear examination of how your observations relate to the narrative we are constructing. By asking what aspects of the story align with the visual elements of the droodle, we can ensure that each piece enhances the overall creativity and coherence of the caption we aim to create.

assistant> I see! The image features a dot in the center with lines radiating from it, and a horizontal line below. What do you find intriguing about this droodle?
user> I'll caption it "Block person planting seeds in a blocky world"

Utilizing the grounding style, we can refine your caption by exploring which elements of the story are visually represented in the droodle, determining if the caption captures the essence of the image. This method allows us to evaluate the humor and novelty of your idea, ensuring it resonates well with both the visual and narrative aspects of the droodle.
